articles.title: BBVA and OpenAI collaborate to transform global banking
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with OpenAI to revolutionize global banking by leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning. This collaboration aims to enhance customer experiences, improve operational efficiency, and drive innovation in financial services. By integrating OpenAI's cutting-edge technology, BBVA seeks to stay at the forefront of the banking industry's digital transformation.

articles.title: BNY builds “AI for everyone, everywhere” with OpenAI
articles.summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with OpenAI to democratize access to artificial intelligence, aiming to make AI more accessible and inclusive for everyone. This collaboration will enable the development of innovative AI solutions, bridging the gap between technology and financial services. By doing so, BNY Mellon is poised to revolutionize the industry with AI-powered tools and services.

articles.title: How We Used Codex to Ship Sora for Android in 28 Days
articles.summary: The team behind Sora successfully shipped the Android version of their app in just 28 days using Codex, a cutting-edge AI-powered coding tool. Codex enabled rapid development by generating boilerplate code and automating repetitive tasks, significantly reducing the time and effort required to launch the app. This achievement showcases the potential of AI-driven coding tools to accelerate mobile app development and improve time-to-market.

articles.title: Advancing science and math with GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a cutting-edge AI model that promises to revolutionize science and math education by providing more accurate and personalized learning experiences. This innovative technology has the potential to assist students and professionals alike in solving complex problems and exploring new ideas. With GPT-5.2, the boundaries of scientific discovery and mathematical understanding are poised to expand significantly.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a significant upgrade to the GPT series, boasting enhanced language understanding and generation capabilities. This new model is expected to revolutionize natural language processing tasks, enabling more accurate and human-like text generation. With GPT-5.2, applications such as chatbots, language translation, and content creation are poised to become even more sophisticated and effective.

articles.title: Improved Gemini audio models for powerful voice experiences
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its Gemini audio models to enhance voice experiences, enabling more accurate and efficient voice recognition. This innovation allows for better speech-to-text capabilities and improved voice assistants. With Gemini, users can expect more powerful and seamless voice interactions across various devices and applications.

articles.title: Deepening our partnership with the UK AI Security Institute
articles.summary: A major tech company has announced a partnership with the UK AI Security Institute to enhance AI security capabilities. This collaboration aims to advance research and development in AI-powered security solutions, improving protection against emerging threats. The partnership is expected to drive innovation in the field of AI security, benefiting both the industry and the public sector.

articles.title: Strengthening our partnership with the UK government to support prosperity and security in the AI era
articles.summary: A major tech company has announced a strengthened partnership with the UK government to drive AI innovation, supporting economic prosperity and national security. This collaboration aims to harness AI's potential to create new opportunities and address emerging challenges. By working together, they seek to establish the UK as a leader in responsible AI development and deployment.

articles.title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive tool for evaluating the factuality of large language models, helping to identify and mitigate the spread of misinformation. This suite assesses models' ability to distinguish between factual and non-factual information, promoting more accurate and reliable language generation. By using FACTS, developers can refine their models to produce more trustworthy outputs.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to combat the challenges of a warming climate, using innovative engineering techniques to enhance their ability to withstand extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This breakthrough aims to improve crop yields and food security in the face of rising global temperatures. By engineering climate-resilient crops, researchers hope to mitigate the impacts of climate change on agriculture and ensure a more sustainable food supply.

articles.title: New in llama.cpp: Model Management
articles.summary: The latest update to llama.cpp introduces model management capabilities, allowing users to easily manage and switch between different AI models. This innovation enables more flexibility and customization in AI applications, making it simpler to adapt to various tasks and use cases. By streamlining model management, llama.cpp enhances the overall user experience and expands its potential applications.

articles.title: Codex is Open Sourcing AI models
articles.summary: Codex is open-sourcing its AI models, allowing developers to access and build upon its cutting-edge technology. This move is expected to accelerate innovation in the field of artificial intelligence and enable the creation of more sophisticated AI-powered applications. By making its models open-source, Codex is democratizing access to AI and fostering a community-driven approach to AI development.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cost-efficient AI model that achieves frontier multimodal performance, enabling efficient processing of various data types such as text, images, and audio. This innovation has the potential to significantly reduce computational costs and increase accessibility to multimodal AI applications. By achieving state-of-the-art results with reduced resources, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker paves the way for more widespread adoption of AI technologies.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The Hugging Face team has introduced swift-huggingface, a comprehensive Swift client that enables seamless integration of Hugging Face's AI models into iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps. This new client allows developers to easily incorporate natural language processing, computer vision, and other AI capabilities into their Apple ecosystem projects. With swift-huggingface, developers can now leverage Hugging Face's vast model repository to build more intelligent and interactive applications.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: DeepMath is a groundbreaking AI agent that utilizes smolagents to provide lightweight math reasoning capabilities, making it more efficient and accessible. This innovation enables the agent to solve complex mathematical problems with reduced computational resources. By leveraging smolagents, DeepMath has the potential to revolutionize math education and problem-solving applications.

articles.title: OpenAI are quietly adopting skills, now available in ChatGPT and Codex CLI
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced a new feature called "skills" in ChatGPT and Codex CLI, allowing users to access specialized capabilities and tools within the platforms. This update enables more precise and efficient interactions, enhancing the overall user experience. By integrating skills, OpenAI is expanding the potential applications of its AI models, making them more versatile and powerful tools.

articles.title: macOS 26.2 enables fast AI clusters with RDMA over Thunderbolt
articles.summary: macOS 26.2 introduces a significant update, enabling fast AI clusters with RDMA (Remote Direct Memory Access) over Thunderbolt, allowing for high-speed data transfer and enhanced AI processing capabilities. This innovation enables developers to create powerful AI clusters using multiple Macs connected via Thunderbolt, accelerating machine learning workloads. The update has the potential to revolutionize AI development and research on Mac platforms.

articles.title: Bit flips: How cosmic rays grounded a fleet of aircraft
articles.summary: A fascinating incident occurred where a fleet of aircraft was grounded due to "bit flips" caused by cosmic rays, which are high-energy particles from space that can alter computer memory. These random changes to the aircraft's computer systems raised safety concerns, prompting the grounding. The event highlights the unexpected vulnerability of modern technology to cosmic interference, underscoring the need for robust error-correction mechanisms.

articles.title: Google Removes Sci-Hub Domains from U.S. Search Results Due to Dated Court Order
articles.summary: Google has removed Sci-Hub domains from US search results, complying with a 2017 court order that ruled in favor of academic publisher Elsevier. This move aims to curb access to the popular platform, which provides free access to copyrighted research papers, potentially limiting research and educational opportunities. The removal may drive users to alternative search engines or methods to access Sci-Hub's vast repository of academic content.
